output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of the principles and applications of the Theory of Machines, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary for advanced analysis and design of mechanical systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Theory of Machines! This course delves into the kinematics and dynamics of machinery, focusing on advanced concepts and analytical techniques. We will explore topics such as vibration analysis, balancing of rotating and reciprocating masses, and the dynamics of cam-follower systems.

chapters.description: Advanced methods for determining displacement, velocity, and acceleration of linkages. Focus on analytical techniques and computer-aided analysis.
Gruebler's criterion, Kutzbach criterion, and their applications. Analysis of redundant constraints and overconstrained mechanisms.
Type, number, and dimensional synthesis. Precision point approximation and graphical methods for linkage design.
Equilibrium of mechanisms, free-body diagrams, and superposition methods. Consideration of friction and external forces.
Inertia forces and torques, D'Alembert's principle, and dynamic equilibrium. Analysis of shaking forces and moments.
Static and dynamic balancing, balancing machines, and multi-plane balancing techniques.
Primary and secondary unbalanced forces, balancing methods for single and multi-cylinder engines.

chapters.chapterTitle: Engine Turning Moment Diagrams and Flywheel Design
chapters.description: Fluctuation of energy, coefficient of fluctuation, and flywheel design for speed regulation.
Principles of vibration isolation, transmissibility, and design of vibration isolators.
Analysis of cam-follower systems, jerk analysis, and design of cam profiles for high-speed applications.
Advanced gear geometry, helical gears, bevel gears, and worm gears. Analysis of gear forces and stresses.

chapters.chapterTitle: Dynamics of Belt and Chain Drives
chapters.description: Analysis of belt tension, power transmission, and efficiency. Dynamics of chain drives and sprocket design.
